data.title: Adds a way to retrieve the number of layers
Add support for querying attribute and uniform size to ShaderProgram
data.body: Add support for querying attribute and uniform size (fix issue 742)

data.title: Switched modifier to public
data.body: Enable custom map loaders not residing in the *.tiled namespace to set owned textures

data.title: Fix issue 1231 for MathUtils.atan2()
data.body:
If x and y are small enough, the MathUtils.atan2(y,x) will crash.
My fix detects this case and calls the Math.atan2(y,x) instead.

https://code.google.com/p/libgdx/issues/detail?id=1231

data.title: add proper HTTPStatus implementation
data.body: Corrected the pull request according to the discussion at https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/pull/276

data.title: Fix IOSNet POST request to close the stream and set content length correctly.
Small corrections to MathUtil random javadoc.
Added coordinate properties for objects
data.body: Now, reading out the values x and y for objects is possible without the use of specific subclasses of MapObject.

data.title: add proper HttpStatus implementation
data.body: HttpStatus are very useful, I think they should be included as part of the libGDX Net implementation, at least I find most projects would otherwise import them manually anyway.

data.title: Small changes to Matrix4 and Vector3
data.body:
Removed some usage of Vector3.tmp and Matrix4.tmpV. And changed some code along the way. Some of which are:
- Add Matrix4#set(x, y, z, w), which is most likely needed to remove the temp quat usage.
- Deprecate Vector3.tmp/tmp(), etc.
- Avoid Math.sqrt where possible (eg in Vector3#isUnit).
- Remove unneeded assignments (eg in Vector3#dst)
- Precalculate the divide in Vector3#prj
- Small bugfix in Vector3#slerp (if (dot > 0.99995 || dot < 0.9995) was probably not intended :))
- Add Vector#clamp(min, max), inline with Vector#limit(max)
- Deprecate Vector3#scale as it's the same as #mul.

data.title: AssetManager: Add filetype dependent loaders.
Update CONTRIBUTORS
data.body: Added me (Manuel Bua) to contributors

data.title: Quaternion: small bugfix in #setFromCross
data.body:
Math#acos returns the angle in radians, while #setFromAxis expects the angle to be in degrees (hence, it starts with: angle \* MathUtils.degreesToRadians). Another option would be to add a method like #setFromAxisRadians.

Edit: might as well remove the tmp depency. This requires that the caller has normalized the vectors.

data.title: Various fixes (enable custom map loaders to setOwnedTextures / add support for querying attribute and uniform size to ShaderProgram)
data.body: Custom map loaders won't be able to set owned textures when not residing in the *.tiled namespace, hence the modified switched to "public".

data.title: AssetManager: separate addAsset
data.body:
Separate addAsset from updateTask. This allows to extend AssetManager and adding assets without using a task (e.g. manually loaded assets to display a loading screen). It could even have a public version, but that requires more checks (like #load does).

On a side note: I also have a modified version of AssetManager to allow (but not force) specifying different loaders based on filetype (suffix). Are you interested in such a change?

data.title: Update libmpg123
data.body:
Updated libmpg123 to the latest version (version 1.15.1, dated 2013-02-23). Tested in win64 and android. Note the extra android compiler switch to define the assembler byte alignment, which might be also needed for other compilers (iOS?).

This might resolve issue 1301
http://code.google.com/p/libgdx/issues/detail?id=1301

data.title: Bullet, fix issue 1299
data.body: Added a type mapping for Vector3[] to btVector3[]. If needed, this can be used in other cases as well where a vector array (or other class array) is required.

data.title: Better foreign support for softKeyboard for Android backend
data.body:
I noticed that the softKeyboard diden't catch ACTION_MULTIPLE which contained some important functionality for foregin characters and swype typing.

This commit triggets mulitple KEY_TYPE events when an ACTION_MULTIPLE onKey event is triggered. So far I haven't encountered any problems with the UI widgets that might follow from these changes. It should maybe be noted that the font needs to support the characters, but other than that any UNICODE character should be supported  from softKeyboards now.

data.title: Fixed (seemingly copy&paste) bug that made several gamepad buttons/slide...
data.body: ...rs/povs unavailable.

data.title: Fix Issue 1283
data.body:
Fixed handling TMX polyline objects with only two points and switched
object vertices to be stored in local coordinates.

PolylineMapObject are now backed by the new Polyline class. By default
y-axis positions are flipped for environments where the y-axis
points up.

data.title: Add margin per pixmap to PixmapPacker, fix the FreeType extensions issues on rendering
data.body:
Hi, I am littlebtc (Hsiao-Ting Yu) from the Briareus Network Techonology, a game engine startup in Taiwan. We are developing our commercial game engine and using libgdx in our Android client implementation. Libgdx is very great and we love it <3

However, we encountered some problems about the freetype extensions. Due to the large size of asian scripts, we use the Motoya Japanese font from Android Open Source Project ( [Font on GitHub Mirrors](https://github.com/android/platform_frameworks_base/blob/master/data/fonts/MTLmr3m.ttf) ), and dynamically generate the BitmapFont using the freetype extension.

However, Motoya fonts includes some punctuation mark with halt width and height (e.g. 22px font has 7x9 full-sized comma), the PixmapPacker cannot efficiently deal with that type of various glyph sizes, and the generator did not give the enought size for drawing to the page. So the glyphs will be drawn on the second page, and since BitmapFontCache will only use one texture, the font rendering will be simply broken.

![Result](http://i.imgur.com/hccEgBq.png)
The texture page when rendering "" with MTLmr3m, sized 22, where "" is absent.

To fix it, I investigate the rendering part and the pull request is my solution:
1. Improve the calulation of the PixmapPacker size; consider the packer padding and use ceil(sqrt(text.length)) to ensure there will always be enough spaces to fill the texts.
2. Allow setting "margins" for every pixmaps on the packer, this will make PixmapPacker places every texts in gird and there will be no strange position anymore.

---

And about the CLA, I discussed with my employer and we decided to sign a Corporate CLA (from Briareus Network Technology) instead of Personal CLA. Can we make a modification from Apache's Corporate CLA and sign? :smile:

data.title: Adds padding to drawable width to account for a NinePatch's content area...
data.body:
It looks like when Lists are given a NinePatch with which to draw the selected element, they don't account for the padding in their width calculation. This means the font drawn inside the box is properly padded from the left, but since the box's width didn't increase, it causes the text to run off the right edge of the box.

My fix simply adds the left and right padding to the width while drawing.

Here's the incorrect padding calculation:
![IncorrectList](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/30749/190235/381a6d1e-7ed8-11e2-9627-643f877f2b1d.PNG)

Here is what it should look like:
![CorrectList](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/30749/190229/e566e1ec-7ed7-11e2-85d9-c55df29e9671.PNG)

And here is the configuration of the NinePatch using the android tool. Notice the bottom row of pixels signifying horizontal padding in the content area (also visible by the blue box on the right)
![NinePatchConfiguration](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/30749/190230/ebb72f16-7ed7-11e2-85e6-0a233b00fa68.PNG)

data.title: Audio: Add Decoder#canSeek, setPosition, getPosition, readSamples, CircularFloatBuffer, etc.
data.body:
- Adds seeking (getPosition/setPosition) to Decoder
- Add Decoder#readSamples(float[]), (it makes sense to let the decoder decide how it reads its samples, just like AudioDevice has a writeSamples(float[]))
- Add CircularBuffer#skip and #getAvailable.
- Modify CircularBuffer#combine (it was based on unsigned short, see http://www.vttoth.com/CMS/index.php/technical-notes/68, I might add a better combining method).
- Add CircularFloatBuffer, which is basically a copy of CircularBuffer but with float[] instead of short[].  
- Implements seeking in VorbisDecoder

I'll add seeking later on for Mpg123Decoder and WavDecoder. Currently testing a easier to use API for audio DSP using gdx-audio, which I will commit in parts (if you like), this is the first. I'm also considering updating some libs (like soundtouch) with the latest version.

Simple example, showing some basic usage: http://youtu.be/ih35EqKZRSw

data.title: Small changes to Color, add comment to ShapeRenderer#rect
data.body:
- Added comment to ShapeRenderer#rect so it's clear which color is used for which corner.
- Deprecated Color.tmp to discourage futher usage.
- Added Color#lerp
- Modifiy some methods (taking r,g,b,a float values) to return the Color object itself, inline with the same methods (taking a Color value).

data.title: SQLite database cross-platform extension implementation.
data.body:
This is a continuation of a previous pull request [closed] that implemented cross-platform SQLite API directly into the Libgdx core. Ref: https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/pull/222

As per the small discussion, I have implemented it as a separate extension that currently supports Desktop and Android.

The Desktop implementation uses SQLite JDBC from https://bitbucket.org/xerial/sqlite-jdbc/wiki/Home while the Android implementation only uses the Android SQLite API.

data.title: Add Application#getApplicationListener()
data.body: Note that this was already implemented as AndroidLiveWallpaper#getListener and GwtApplication#getApplicationListener but not in the interface itself. I deprecated AndroidLiveWallpaper#getListener.

data.title: Update README.md
data.body: This is the github.com "homepage" for Libgdx.  Instead of updating the compilation instructions I just deleted them all in preference to links into the wiki.  I also took a pass over the links to the various resources to add a bit of context and sort them.

data.title: Remove Vector2.tmp() and its variations (.tmp{1,2,3})
data.body:
This change removes the public static mutable "tmp" objects from `Vector2`.  Mostly they're replaced with _private_ static mutable tmp objects elsewhere in the code.  

I could probably reduce the number of scratch objects in the scene2d code, if anyone objects to the number created (I think its 10 new and 3 removed).

There is one free cleanup of a `Vector3` tmp usage while I was in Stage.

This breaks the API since `Vector2.tmp`\* were all public.

Some discussion on this topic: http://www.badlogicgames.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=23&t=7814  Folks are free to change their opinions now that they've got a concrete example.  :)
